channel.description: Recent content in Cloud on Kavesh Naidoos Blog

item.title: Azure Active Directory: A Cloud-based Identity and Access Management Solution
item.description: Introduction Azure Active Directory (AAD) is a cloud-based identity and access management solution developed by Microsoft. It is built on top of the same technology as on-premises Active Directory (AD) and provides many of the same features, but with the added benefits of being hosted in the cloud. In this post, we will take a closer look at what AAD is, how it works, and some of its key features.

item.title: Understanding Active Directory: What It Is and How It Works
item.description: Introduction Active Directory (AD) is a directory service developed by Microsoft for Windows domain networks. It is used to store information about network resources, including user accounts, computers, and other devices, as well as manage their access. In this post, we will take a closer look at what AD is, how it works, and some of its key features. What is Active Directory? Active Directory is a centralized database that stores information about network resources and allows for the management of access to those resources.
